newsitem.title: USA: Marvel Entertainment Q3 loss expected.
newsitem.headline: Marvel Entertainment Q3 loss expected.

text.p: Marvel Entertainment Group Inc said on Tuesday that it expects to report a net loss for the third quarter ended September 20 of between $0.07 and $0.12, including a non-recurring, pre-tax gain of about $22 million.
The company attributed the loss to continued weakness in its trading card, publishing and consumer products licensing businesses.
It said those market conditions are expected to result in a net loss for its fourth quarter and year-end results ending December 31.

Marvel Entertainment said it failed to satisfy certain financial covenants contained in its bank credit facilities and has begun discussions with its agent bank seeking waivers and a restructuring of the facilities to provide for its cash requirements.

The company believes that such a restructuring will ultimately require an infusion of new equity capital. It also has begun discussions to obtain the necessary funds to meet its current and long-term needs.
The one-time gain of $22 million is from its sale of shares of Toy Biz Inc in August.
The company expects to report its third quarter earnings in early November. For the third quarter in 1995, Marvel reported net income of $0.19 per share.
